version_description: This version is based off of Charlie Edmonds interpretation (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fjBQmrID7Ss).

song_name: The Man Who Swears Hes God

version_description: This is the live acoustic version of The Scientist as played in 2013.
It is using perfect 4th tuning instead of standard. Sounds very nice.

Taken from Chris' live KCRW acoustic recording, found here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yr32q5CIhMc . This recorded acoustic version, along with all others I've heard, is not in standard tuning. The high E string string is tuned up 1 half step to F. All other strings remain in standard tuning. Therefore, from top to bottom strings: EADGBF. Note the chord chart for which chord the F string is muted.
I tried to put the chords in the write place and fix some lyrics. I also added a capo to make it easier to play on acoustic.
This tab is in standard tuning the other all have a dropped tuning
Tried to do it on an E key also for make an intro that sounds like the record or similar.
this version is more accurate, adding chord-changes at the end of most sentences as is played by the band
